Generation I.Red: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.
Generation I.Yellow: It is born with the ability to defy gravity. It floats in air on powerful electromagnetic waves.
Generation I.Stadium: Appears as if out of nowhere. It floats using anti-gravity and discharges electricity from two side-mounted units.

Generation II.Gold: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach trainers if they are using their Pok é gear .
Generation II.Silver: The units at the sides of its body generate anti-gravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
Generation II.Crystal: The electricity emitted by the units on each side of its body cause it to become a strong magnet.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach trainers if they are using their POK é GEAR . (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) The units at the sides of its body generate anti-gravity energy to keep it aloft in the air. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this Pok é mon clinging to the breaker box.
Generation III.Sapphire: Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This Pok é mon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.
Generation III.Emerald: The units at its sides are extremely powerful magnets. They generate enough magnetism to draw in iron objects from over 300 feet away.
Generation III.FireRed: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Uses antigravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses Thunder Wave and similar moves.

Generation IV.Diamond: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
Generation IV.Pearl: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
Generation IV.Platinum: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach Trainers if they are using their Pokégear.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.

Generation V.Black: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
Generation V.White: The faster the units at its sides rotate, the greater the magnetic force they generate.
Generation V.Black 2: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
Generation V.White 2: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.

Generation VI.X: The units at the sides of its body generate antigravity energy to keep it aloft in the air.
Generation VI.Y: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Magnemite attaches itself to power lines to feed on electricity. If your house has a power outage, check your circuit breakers. You may find a large number of this Pokémon clinging to the breaker box.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This Pokémon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.

Generation VII.Sun: They gather in places where electricity is available. They can be found clinging to the steel towers used to support power lines.
Generation VII.Moon: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it's eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It's frequently the cause of power outages, which is why some power plants send out electrical signals that it can't stand.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Perhaps because electrical lines are often buried these days, the number of Magnemite attacks on power plants has increased.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity. It floats while emitting powerful electromagnetic waves.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity. It floats while emitting powerful electromagnetic waves.

Generation VIII.Sword: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it'll start moving again.
Generation VIII.Shield: It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it emits electromagnetic waves from the units on each side of its body.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: The units at its sides generate electromagnetic waves that keep it airborne. It feeds on electricity.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
Generation IX.Violet: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges electromagnetic waves and so on from the units at its sides.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Routes 6 , 11 , 38 , and 39 Safari Zone (Peak, default; Wasteland, default)
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Routes 6 , 11 , 38 , and 39 Safari Zone (Peak, default; Wasteland, default)

Generation VII.Sun: Trainers' School , Hau'oli City , Malie City , Poké Pelago
Generation VII.Moon: Trainers' School , Hau'oli City , Malie City , Poké Pelago
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Trainers' School , Hau'oli City , Malie City
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Trainers' School , Hau'oli City , Malie City

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Challenge Beach Fields of Honor , Forest of Focus , Challenge Beach , Brawlers' Cave , Courageous Cavern , Stepping-Stone Sea ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Fuego Ironworks ( Swarm ) Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Whiteout Cave , Icy Cave , Glacial Cavern
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Fuego Ironworks ( Swarm ) Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Whiteout Cave , Icy Cave , Glacial Cavern

Generation IX.Scarlet: East Province: Area Two , Area Three Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
Generation IX.Violet: East Province: Area Two , Area Three Tera Raid Battles ( 2★ )
Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Canyon Biome , Chargestone Cavern , Polar Biome
